alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Gates, and central Isle of Wight Counties, the City of Poquoson, the City of Norfolk, the City of Chesapeake, the City of Portsmouth, the City of Suffolk, the western City of Virginia Beach, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 445 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Windsor to Suffolk to Sunbury. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Downtown Suffolk and Kings Fork around 405 PM EDT. Smithfield and Driver around 415 PM EDT. Deep Creek, Chesapeake, Bowers Hill and Western Branch around 420 PM EDT. Churchland, Suffolk, Crittenden, Cradock and Rescue around 425 PM EDT. Downtown Portsmouth, Downtown Norfolk, Norfolk State University, Old Dominion University and Ghent around 430 PM EDT. Great Bridge, Regent University, Portsmouth, Northampton, Norview and Norfolk NAS around 435 PM EDT. Hampton, Hampton University, Virginia Wesleyan University, Ocean View, Kempsville, Langley AFB, Norfolk, Norfolk International, Fort Monroe and Fentress around 440 PM EDT. Buckroe Beach and Grand View around 445 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Norfolk, Carrollton, Portlock, Longview, Benns Church, Suffolk Airport, Huntersville, Buckland, Hilton Village and Chuckatuck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Suffolk; Virginia Beach
